text:
If no client certificate is returned by the browser an abortive shutdown is
performed by Apache which results in no headers being sent.

It would be nice to have an error code sent back resulting in some headers for
the browser to process.

[Tue Jan 15 13:39:37 2008] [info] SSL Library Error: 336105671
error:140890C7:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE:peer did not return a
certificate No CAs known to server for verification?
[Tue Jan 15 13:39:37 2008] [info] [client 127.0.1.1] Connection closed to child
3 with abortive shutdown (server mysrver:443)
creator: ianl@mediatel.co.uk

text:
This is expected behaviour.  You can implement a custom 403 response using 

  SSLVerifyClient optional
  SSLRequire %{SSL_CLIENT_VERIFY} eq "SUCCESS"

and a CGI ErrorDocument which uses the SSL_* env vars; see the mod_ssl reference
docs.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
